website_summaries.verdict: This bag ensures you can carry your tripod comfortably and safely at all times.
pros: Shockproof bag consists of nylon and other high-end materials
Includes carrying straps and a padded handle for added convenience
Comes with an extra pocket on the side, enabling you to carry your camera batteries and other accessories on the go
Provides a great choice for outdoor photographers
cons: Inside zipper tends to break easily

customer_reviews.title: Protects your expensive tripod extremely well.
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a perfect product. My tripod is expensive and it is very important to my work. I need to protect it as well as I do my camera, but also not trip over it when I am traveling. This case is extremely well-padded and yet not heavy to carry. Its over-the-shoulder carrying capability fits my needs perfectly. I will probably never have to re-purchase this heavy duty carrying case again, but if I did, I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: RHJ_pops

customer_reviews.title: Great to travel light
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my light stands. Now I don’t gave to bring my large photography box everywhere and can travel light.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Smith

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BAG FOR YOUR TRIPOD.
customer_reviews.text: PROBABLY IT IS NOT THE BEST CARRYING BAG, BUT IS EXCELLENT FOR THE MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Chiro 77

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!  Fits K&M Baby Spider Pro with 2 tier.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag! Using the bag with a K&M Baby Spider Pro keyboard stand. Fits perfectly even with a second tier connected to the stand.
customer_reviews.author: TuRuGSoY

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Take my Celectron Cosmos 90GT easily (without tripod) it's padded well and has somehwat good protection.
customer_reviews.author: Jassem J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a grear padded carrying bag for tripod. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a grear padded carrying bag for tripod... It is WIDE! for me this is a plus because I can drop in a smaller tripod as well as some light stands and carry everything in one case. It is padded which is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty_Biker

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed to carry the tripod for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to carry the tripod for my Celestron 8SE telescope. Rugged exterior, padded interior with pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice carry bag
customer_reviews.text: As you can see there is plenty of room for my Orion atlas tripod,I am going to purchase another one for my other tripod
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: One D ring came off on first use
customer_reviews.text: I was needing a larger bag for my tripods, carrying tripods and some other stuff in both hands wasnt nice, this bag fulfilled my needs, good size for my tripods, my godox octabox SB- UE 31.5in, godox ads7, 2x godox ads17, to godox S type brackets. The reason im putting 3 stars on this review its because on the first use with the long strap, one of the D rings on one end just came off, it was poorly sewn, since then ive been carrying it with the handle. Besides that issue, its been ok for 4 months no other issues. I suppose i was the unlucky one that got a defect on that D ring poorly sewn :)
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo RodriguezTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while then fell apart
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a good gig bag for a couple of microphone stands and a few microphones but after only a few uses, the long strap ripped off completely and some of the side seams are already showing tears. The stands are not heavy so would say that the quality of the bag is pretty poor. For very light use (feathers or air) this would be a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Feehan

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder strap not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag to a total of two gigs, and one of the loops for the shoulder strap already came right off (at the seam that attaches it to the bag). Granted it was pretty full (Manfrotto 190 + prima travel tripod + two sunpak 6601s + softboxes and umbrellas), but I'd expect it to last longer than that. Rest of the bag (including carry handles) is still ok, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Someguy15

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, right item at right price
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, right item at right price. Very roomy, easily holds at least two tripods or a camera with a honking long telephoto with room to spare. This user is not a day in day out heavy duty professional, but appreciates decent stitching, reinforced stress point at handles, strap web wraps around bag fully giving good structural support & smooth zipper (not YKK brand but OK). Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: SecureType

customer_reviews.title: Decent Bag But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tripod bag for a longer tripod I own. I saw this one and gave it a try. The padding is good but the sewing left something to be desired as one of the handles torn on the first shoot with it. I sewed it back up and it works okay. I've had mixed results with Neewer products and this one does the job for the price. It's not the most durable product out there but, again, the price is right especially if you don't use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: joelpackman

customer_reviews.title: Nice... and BIG
customer_reviews.text: Just received, so the jury's still out on durability but seems well made and good quality. But... this... is... a BIG bag. I bought for one large tripod and will keep it but it's much bigger circumference than I needed. Easily would hold two tripods or several light stands, although they would bang together. But for the price I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: PaulBinCT

customer_reviews.title: Very cool bag. My handle broke thought
customer_reviews.text: Very cool bag. My handle broke thought. I think it was because of excessive use. If you travel alot maybe invest in something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. The quality is more than I could have hoped and what's more, it fit my Celestron Heavy-Duty Altazimuth Tripod perfectly! It's as if it was made specifically for it. Padding is awesome and there is a small zippered compartment both inside and out. Loads of space and easy to carry. Way to go, Neewer! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Van Patten

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag, but beware the zipper!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this bag is good quality, but the zipper is far too small and not heavy duty enough to withstand the rigors that a padded field equipment bag goes through. With a solid zipper, this would be a great bag, but our friends in China too often skimp on quality. My zipper broke after three weeks and I replaced the bag with a much better Manfrotto bag at double the price because you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rooney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my mic and guitar stands!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my band's stage gear. This is perfect for my guitar stands(3) and boom mic stands (2). Can fit alot more but still not too big to be unruly. The previous bag I had from Gator was insanely gigantic (it had to go back). This is a well made, durable and sensibly sized. The zipper is high quality. I expect this will last a good time. 5 stars. Very impressed
customer_reviews.author: Tech Geek Reviews

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than most bags... for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Not a good bag. Did its job fine for a little while, but it fell apart quickly. The strap broke after a couple months of use and I see the rest of it going soon as well. If you're active and actually use your gear and require a sturdy bag to carry everything around in, this isn't it. Go for an established brand like Manfrotto or something of the sort.
customer_reviews.author: Athanasios

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Well padded. Will definitely accommodate holding tripod and other photography accessories like lighting kit. Long shoulder step is adjustable. Stitching seems to be well done. Overall very durable and impressed by quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smart

customer_reviews.title: Huge! Big bag!
customer_reviews.text: Returned the bag. It’s very nice but it’s huge! Not like the photo. Much Much too large. You can fit three tripods in this bag. My tripod is the Manfroto 055 if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Nawlinsdiva

customer_reviews.title: not the same
customer_reviews.text: look at the actual bag, it is not the same. i returned.
customer_reviews.author: MSB

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for light stands
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice big bag. Holds a few light stands and other things depending on the shoot. We throw extra head phones, travel tripods, and other somewhat durable items in here to consolidate for a shoot. The padding is decent and has protected our light stands and similar pieces of equipment from minor collisions with doorways and other annoying structures. Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: CalloftheLoon

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my telescope and tripod, works like a dream! My telescope is Orion 120ST with a heavy duty video tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Alex_S

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I really like the bag. It is a little larger in diameter than I expected but it still works out fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... of the strap broke within a week but overall nice carrying case
customer_reviews.text: Part of the strap broke within a week but overall nice carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: ... previous case where the zipper was poorly designed and easily broke. This case is large enough for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous case where the zipper was poorly designed and easily broke. This case is large enough for a couple of light stands and misc items. And the zipper is strong
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for an incredible price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great bag, especially for the price. It's not super padded but it offers good general protection. I was really surprised by the quality of this bag. P.S. For those reviewers upset there was no shoulder strap, take a look in the inside pocket :)
customer_reviews.author: Ohana Films

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Love love love...my greatest fear about these bags are the build quality...this is a well padded and well sown bag for the price. Great for all of the umbrellas and light stands I own that didn't come in a decent bag...I can throw my speedlites in there as well..
customer_reviews.author: R. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room and great quality. This bag fits 3 lights
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room and great quality. This bag fits 3 lights, 2 umbrellas, a tripod and all of the cables/bulbs. Perfect for what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag - good quality and padding! I got this to carry my tripod as the bag it came with was not that great / padded. Feel more comfortable with this padded bag from Neewer - less potential damage to the tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, seems well constructed, durable. I've got two 9' light stands and two full size (not video) tripods in it no problem.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: ... Strong Carring Case"""""Well Made'''''My Stand Of Congas Fits Perfect'''''I Recommend This Carring Case
customer_reviews.text: Very Strong Carring Case"""""Well Made'''''My Stand Of Congas Fits Perfect'''''I Recommend This Carring Case 100%''''
customer_reviews.author: James Sonsini

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Solid construction and stitching. Roomy. I have paid 3X as much for tripod bags that aren't half as good. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Art F

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke with 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the large bag. Put a tripod and monopod inside it and it has tore off one of the straps. I have attempted to contact the seller which they have no responded to.
customer_reviews.author: virginia zhao

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, probably not meant for a full time photographer
customer_reviews.text: After a little bit of use it's starting to show the reason it's so well priced. Don't get me wrong, I don't baby my equipment but I figured it would at least last me a year. The zipper lining is starting to come loose (stitching is coming off). Otherwise, if you're more of a casual photographer, this is a great bag at a great price and if you're not using it every weekend it will get the job done for far less than the other bags
customer_reviews.author: Elmer Escobar

customer_reviews.title: This bag is a perfect fit for my 2 camera stands and more
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a perfect fit for my 2 camera stands and more, there is enough space in this bag to carry other flash accessories.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have two Neewer light stands, both fit perfectly into bag with other accessories. Appears to be good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. BS

customer_reviews.title: Not even similar to the image pictured, sizes inaccurate (LARGE)
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Large. It’s seriously enormous. I have 3 incredibly common industry standard tripods and collect bags for them. This bag can fit any 2 of them comfortably. Also, not pro-level padding. The bags you see here are the generic USA Gear 21-35”, the Promaster TB5, this Neewer, and the legendary, perfect for all reasons, now discontinued Hakuba. The top 2 run small. The Hakuba is perfect if you can find it. I hear there’s a calumette that’s similar. - Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Spanky Of Nazareth

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget lightstand case
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed for a budget case. Checked it on the plane fully loaded. Came back unscathed. Will buy again. Packed it with the box for the 2 set PBL PRO HEAVY DUTY 7'6" lightstands.
customer_reviews.author: D. madden

customer_reviews.title: Great construction
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this product to carry my spare axles for my side by side. The bag is very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, great. But the zipper is already tweeked. Good padding. I fit a monopod and slider together in it.
customer_reviews.author: JP Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: Great size and padding.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size and price. Holds several light stands and softbox.
customer_reviews.author: JimD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it is worth the money, Will need to see how it holds up to use.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: I like how big it is
customer_reviews.text: I like how big it is, but I've only used it a few times, and not overloaded with weight, and the shoulder strap already broke. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for quality and construction but...
customer_reviews.text: Well made bag,great quality, real padding and full length zipper, 5 stars for quality and construction but the size was not as described, mine was 36" x 7" x 9" unfortunately the extra inch in length and height just leaves too much room to securely carry my single tripod. I'll say this is the best bag I have ordered ( I've tried 5 from manufactures) and the size issue seems to be universal, most were smaller than described and a few were bigger so it's trial and error...I ended up returning with no hassle....thanks Amazon..
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great for what I needed filled it up with all my guitar accessories, music stand, gooseneck mic stand two guitar cords, two mic cords, microphone, etc. still room for more.
customer_reviews.author: SnP. Bailey

product_meta.title: Neewer 35"x7"x8"/90x18x20cm Padded Carrying Bag with Strap for Manfrotto,Sirui,Vanguard,Ravelli and Dolica Series Stands and Other Universal Light Stands, Boom Stand and Tripod
product_meta.description: Note:The tripod is not included,the bag is empty. Description: It has padded compartments,which keep all your gears safe while taking your photography or video studio on the go. This will ensure your tripod or studio kit when not in use is properly protected from dirt,moisture,dust and damage. It comes with a padded handle for secure transportation in your hand Great as a carrying case for your tripod in outdoor / outing photography Specifications: Inner Size: 35" x 7" x 8" /90 x 18 x 20 cm Outer Size: 36" x 7.7" x 8.9"/91.5x 19.5 x 22.5cm Material: Nylon Color:Black Package Include: 1 x 35"/90cm Tripod Bag
feature_bullets: It is made of strong and durable nylon material,heavy-duty and shockproof.
The extra side pocket can be used for cables, batteries and other gadgets.
Carrying straps are very sturdy for hand carry.
This bag makes it possible to pack up your light stand and tripods anytime, anywhere.
Comes with padded handle,which makes carrying your tripod much more comfortable.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars275 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
